review: Stunned. Went there two weeks ago on a Saturday night with the hubby for dinner. YUCK!! Potato skins were hard as rocks and didn't have bacon or scallions on them. Sent them back. Replacements were not much better. Mini Philly cheese steaks...half the roll was rock hard, half soggy. Replacements were even worse. There were chunks of nasty black burnt cheese in them and not a single pepper could be found(the Philly cheesesteaks use cheese sauce so this was clearly burnt cheese from a flat top that hadnt been cleaned). When the manager came over he was like "yeah that's some burnt cheese, it happens." really?? Then to top it off, my entree was hideous. The steak looked like it had been run over by a truck and there was more fat than meat. The mashed potatoes were like wall paper paste. The apples and cinnamon were quite good. Our server was friendly and the manager seemed to not really care. He comped the food that was horrible and our bill ended up being $9.00. Still tipped the waitress $20.00 but I will NEVER go back. If the manager doesn't care about the food then why should the employees...

Chili's....All day, every day 2-4-1 drinks, who can really beat that? This Chili's is located right smack in the center of West Miramar's residential area surrouding from the north is Pines.   Had a great experience one evening when I felt just plain o' lazy to cook dinner and decided to go to the closest place to stuff my stomach and go straight to sleep. Believe it or not, from the moment that we sat down and received our meal and paid our bill, it was all under a half hour.  BELIEVE IT! Went in, looked at the menu and ordered a Chicken wrap and the Margarita Chicken and it came out steamy hot and cooked to perfection.  Wait staff is very friendly and service is above all at this location...Give it a try locals!
I always come here for the drinks!! haha but the food is not bad either :) ...get your free nachos and drink drink drink! can't get better than that..2 for 1 baby!

When Fridays come around my wife and I usually order from here and pick it up. The taste and the quality of the food is what it is to be expected from a chain. Sometimes great, sometimes not so good. Recently we have been seing a steady decline of the tast of the food. For example chicken with no flavor, just salt or with an enormous amount of pepper. Not edible. Corn on the cob, they forgot the butter. Steak and Shrimp Fajitas with shrimp floating in pepper. It seems like everything gets a bath in either salt or pepper. Come on guys I know it's a chain but you an do a lot better than this. The only reason we order from here is because it's less than a mile from our home which makes it totally convenient. But unfortunately I must say we will start taking further trips to get a decent plate of food.

First time in South Florida in a minute. Decided to check this place out to meet a friend. Ended up in the back of the restaurant near the bathrooms for seating, which bothered me, but not my local friend. Decided to try a few drinks during Happy Hour as well as the garlic chicken salad. Needless to say I wasn't impressed and still not a fan of franchise restaurants. Will give a few other places a try next time instead.

Short to the point our family sat right away, took our order and our food was at our table within the next few mis. And it was great the free nachos they give you aren't bad either helps with the wait which isn't long anyway but it doesn't hurt. Enjoy your food. Cheers.

You get what you pay for. Friendly service and a nice environment, but they change their menu too often and while the food is consistent, don't expect too much since it is still a chain restaurant. Overall, I dine here about twice a month with my family and find it a fairly decent experience.

Chili's Update Review for 10/12/13. We are nicely greeted and seated as always, the waiter was the same one from the visit in 8/21/13. The food and drinks came in a little normal pace, it was a bit crowded when we came in. Nothing was wrong with the drinks we had ordered. We ordered food from the same 2 for $20 special, for the appetizers we had 2 chips (one from the lounge which is free and the one from the $20 menu) and then we have the flatbread which tasted alike a pizza, no problems there. We all had the classic bacon burgers served well done and no salt on the fires. We had no desert in this visit. Overall this visit as I will rate it was full 5 stars, we left the place full and happy.

Who doesn't like a Chili's???? LOVE LOVE LOVE this food!!!  Southwest eggrolls to DIE FOR!!! yum YUM yum!!! So why the 3 stars - went for lunch and the bartender was having a really ruff day!!   Took a really long time to order (even though I told her I was "in a rush"), and then she served my food incomplete when it did come (i.e. spinach dip with no chips).  No soda refill.  Took forever to get my check, etc.  I asked the hosts for help but nothing! The manager eventually came over (at my request), got me chips, more soda and my check plus cashed me out (thank heavens).  He was pleasant and apologetic. Great lunch deals at chilis too - absolutely love this chain - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Love my local Chili's.  I always get great service, whether i'm dining in or getting curb side.  The food is always neatly prepared, and perfect.  I also love their chips and salsa.  Yummy!  The taste and quality of the food is exceptional as well.  We are always in and out of this chili's, which makes a whole lot of difference when kids are involved.  Always great deals too!

My husband and I go to this location often on Friday evenings for two for one drinks. It's Chili's so I don't expect great! Hell, I barely expect good food here but it's been edible which is all I ask for. Well Chili's has these new chipotle bowls on the menu and it looks so beautiful and fresh on the menu's photo so I thought to myself...why not give it a try?When my chipotle bowl came out, I couldn't believe what I was looking at! It literally looked like they had scraped food off of a bunch of old plates and created what they call a chipotle bowl. I had everything in that bowl... a piece of broccoli, one penne pasta, a piece of what looked like fried chicken, and even a piece of shredded carrot...and none of that came in the bowl! I was disgusted because I'm almost sure I was served scraps! And to make matters more awful...it was room temp cold! I can't even imagine why they would serve anyone something like that. I am still dumbfounded as I type this! I told my waiter, who looked embarrassed as he waved the manager over (who also looked embarrassed)! The funniest part of the story is, they offered to make me another one!!! HA!!! ANOTHER BOWL OF SCRAPS...the kinda scraps you would serve to a stray?!!! I feel the chipotle bowl is just that...a bowl filled with leftovers! Absolutely NOT! I will never order this again!

Service? Far far from where it is used to be :(. I picked this place to celebrate my birthday with my family since I had just a couple of hours before heading to airport, after 45 min they showed up with the soup offering their apologies for the long wait, 1 hour and 15 min later I asked for the status of our main course, and the waitress offer his apologies again for the long wait, I asked for the Manager, he showed up and offer an apology again, third one so far in the day. After 1 hour a d 30 min, we decided to leave. The Manager is totally absent from the main floor, buried in his office or kitchen. We have used plates over the table with waitress coming by and not realizing that it will be good to pickup the appetizer plates before people ask for the check, bottom line, a disaster, not a place to celebrate or expect decent service.
Terrible takeout service.  Cold food that took an hour longer than promised.  Don't bother.

This place sucks!!!!!! I went tonight to the Chili's in Miramar on Miramar Parkway. The bathrooms were very dirty the trash can was overflowing!!!! Our waiter was not good at all he never brought us Napkins, Refills, or anything else. The hostess was totally lost he took 5 minutes to get a table!!!! When there were tables all the way in the back empty!! My dad's steak was undercooked he took it back for a new one and got one but it was too tough. I myself ordered a Old Timer with Cheese the fries were not enough and they were quite stingy. My brothers fries were also not enough. Overall we were not pleased with our service. I would not recommend this place to anyone I will not be returning here anytime soon!!! I'll say it again this is place is total CRAP!!!!! It SUCKS!!!!! The servers name was Antonio ask for a different server if you get him if you go. Javier Valdivia
Chilis is one of my favorite casual restaurant.  I recommend ordering chips and salsa as an appetizer.  For the main course order either the nachos or the sliders.

Our waiter Serge was wonderful. We went there and the experience was nice. The customer service was pleasing and the food was great.I didn't find a hair in my food so I knew this was the place to be ok with.  I love it. We both ordered the fried cheese for the appetizer then  baby back ribs with sweet potato fries and watermelon lemonade. (YAY!) It was an appetizer and two entres for 20$?! yes you heard it right...20$  I was just a happy camper there. Very pleased.
Bad service at the bar. I came in for a dessert and had to wait 20 minutes before my order was taken. The Long Island was like a lemonade frosty. I will not be back. Choose any other one.

WORST EXPERIENCE! After arriving at 9:35, waited for a hostess 10 min, and 15 minutes for a waiter. Minutes later, another waiter came by our table to let us know he would be taking over. The first waiter came and apologized (strange drama). The salt with chips (not chips with salt) was difficult to eat. We, of course, drank up our drink quickly and had to stand up to find another waiter for refills. We got refills, and then waiter two  showed up to take our order. The burger was overcooked, served with fries instead of loaded mashed pot. Mashed potatoes came much after the burger was gone and it was plain, tasted reheated. The sw pair was not edible, it was salt and pepper with a tad of food. The tostada was cracked, salty and old. The enchilada was loaded with pepper, the rice must have been made the day before, the beans were cold. By now is past 10 pm and we had to get drinks refills at the bar ourselves. We waited another 20 minutes for our waiter to enter our dessert coupon code and another 10 for it to be served (past 11 pm). I commented how bad the food was to the waiter who came with a latex glove and told us how he'd cut himself so bad, he said the mgr would come see us (I am still waiting, he never came). THUMBS DOWN! Go to Weston location, much, much better.
The chilis located at mirmar pkway and dykes smells like wet old rags. Don't beleieve me? Come in at 11 when they open, oh and you don't seem to exist until somebody does actually notices you.

This was my first time at this location. I ordered a regular meal that I always had gotten at another location. It came out and it didn't taste quite right. I felt bad about telling the waiter. He wasn't bothered at all and sent the manager, Melissa, over to check in. She was very polite and understanding and sent me over another item from the menu. When I was packing up my left overs she came by before I could close the bag with a tiny container of ranch for my chicken. I will definitely be back! That is true customer service at it's finest!
Food is excellent and our waitress was very friendly but only downfall is they are extremely slow and take way to long. Not recommend to go during lunch time if you only have an hour.

I like this chain of restaurants. The food is always good and the margaritas are awesome. Not bad for lunch or dinner and pretty decent to bring the family to. Can get rather hectic when there are large groups. I don't know why, but every Chilis I've ever been to, for whatever reason, causes poor cell phone reception once you're inside the building. On top of it, they don't have wifi for customers, so it can be a little annoying. It would be nice if corporate would actually start providing wifi for its patrons. Anyway, the food is great and the staff is always friendly. Keep it up guys!

I ate at this location after not having been here since before college. Surprisingly enough Chili's has changed for the better, they have new screens on the table that allow you to order more drinks and play games (which is good if you have kids). The menu has had a pretty good revamp, though they no longer offer chips and salsa which is pretty disappointing. But aside from that the new menu looks great and the new drinks look really good. I ordered sliders with the new pickles, which are strong but really good and a margarita which again was really good.  Service has been hit or miss here in the past, but our server was polite, friendly and fast with our order and extremely nice. Everyone at the bar was also in a good mood and rather friendly so that was an upside to what I had seen in the past there. But other than that it's great to see this new Chili's and this location has great staff as of recent so it made the experience great.

This place used to be much cleaner, there was lots of food and napkins under our table after we got seated. Service was very slow, the place does not seem clean and staff didn't seem to care for cleanliness.

I have a Chili's very close to my house but I decide to drive to this one because the service at the one by my house is absolutely horrible. I've been to this location several times and it's been pretty good so far. Sure there's been a time where I didn't like one waitress but that's ok everything else is a Thumbs up!
The waiter forgot about me. And when they came back, guess what he said? "Can I take your order?" :-)

Horrible! Terrible service and the manager could care less when I complained. 3 lunches, water, no dessert took about 35 minutes and then when asked for napkins, was given a huge attitude like if it was a problem. Then the checks were put on the wrong tables... There went another 15 minutes trying to figure it out! I'm done with trying to give this Chili's location a chance... It's always a mess!!!!

It has been at least a year or more since I last visited this location. I remember it being better and getting more food with your order. I ordered the chicken fajitas and the portion was very small.  I guess that is why you now get free chips and salsa so you can get full on chips. Anyway, giving it 3 stars because the service was not bad and they did change one of the TV's so I could watch the women's soccer game.

It was friday. I was desperate with a 15month old. Where do you go? Local chili's at 8pm. Very busy but very family oriented. Hostess was a little disorganized as i sat close to her and listened to the chaos while we waited patiently for our name to be called. I have to be honest, hubby and I only chose this place because we had a gift card, but i did notice the new technology with ordering and app device on the table as well as new menu items. I really enjoyed my presidente margarita ans my chicken nachos. And with all the other screaming children around us, my 15mo old was an angel.

Yeah this place seems to be getting worse and worse as each time I come here. My dad wanted to go here for lunch and even though I was hugely skeptical from the last time, I said what the hell. Luckily we were seated immediately as soon as we got in but that's when problems started. We were waiting in our booth for a good 15 minutes before I got up to ask where the hell the servers were. Lo and behold, the BARTENDER, who was already handling 3-4 other customers AT THE BAR, came up and apologized and said he was the one supposed to handle our table and he'd be right with us. I've never worked in a restaurant before but this clearly shows how understaffed this place was. It was around 1:30-2 pm when we got here so it's still technically lunch time and there were maybe 1-2 other servers that I saw handling about 6 other tables. Our bartender server himself was sweating it up with constantly moving around between people and took another 10 minutes just for us to get our silverware and then another 10 minutes for drinks.  The food itself tasted alright (my dad got the Mango Chile Chicken and I got the Smoky and Sweet Burger) but food quality here has diminished ever since they were taken over by new management and started changing up the menus. Unfortunately, this is the only Chili's near where I live since they closed the one on Pines Blvd. near Flamingo Rd. probably due to their recent health code violations. But I'm not liking the future of Chili's right about now

I would suggest everyone to stay away from this one.  Greeters are unintelligible and staff are nit witts.  Food is always like warm. Ordered burger bites and they were burnt.  Service is slow.  Probably because we don't drink. So stay away.
Food was excellent! We were a large party of 8 and seating wasn't too comfortable. Avoid the corner booth if more than 6 in your party. Other than this is was great!

Could someone explain to me why my take out food taste different than the actual restaurant food? Or why isn't it as fresh, I know it's take out but hello...today our food was late so shouldn't that mean it should be fresher if it came out late??? But no, chilies is a 4 minute drive from my house so don't think I drive far to start eating. All I'm saying is watch out with their take out, dine in. I'm a chilies fan, love the two for twenty and the two for one drinks. It's a nice place to go when your not in the mood to dine all fancy. Great chain, try to dine with the waiter named Daniel colon, great guy.

Had a great time with the kids, the game console provided me and my husband to enjoy our meal much better. Great invention!! Also the server was very awesome, had lots of patience since we needed time to order the food. On Fridays they have a girl that makes balloons and I must say we were very impressed, from animals to mermaids and princesses for tips. Great places to be with the family

Let me start off by saying this is the only Chili's that doesn't have that weird sour smell... with that said I've never been a fan of Chili's or Tgi Friday's and dreaded eating at both but this location has started to change my mind. I decided to give them a try to try the endless  enchiladas and changed my mind when I saw the menu. I ordered the combo enchilada, quesadilla and tostado all of which were good. The smoked wings lacked flavor but maybe I'm picky cause I have my own smoker and know the flavor of the chip adds flavor. Will keep you posted as I continue to sample their menu...

Terrible staff and management. The waiters stand around talking and when getting their attention only makes them mad. I ordered an 8 oz steak medium rare which they under cooked and it was completely red inside. I politely asked if I could have it cooked a little bit more. A manager then approached me with attitude and said to me next time don't order a medium rare. It was RED inside. It seems like they let anyone run the place or cook in the back. Won't ever be coming back even if they paid me.
Love the bacon ranch quesadillas and Texas cheese fries! Great food comes out hot and quick

Just had the worse experience at this Chili's restaurant.   Got there with my family of 8 at 11:50 a.m. with no one in line waiting for a table. The hostess left to go clean off the table so we could sit. At 12:22 p.m., we were still waiting for the hostess to return. Two parties of 10 came after us and were seated by a waiter working the self-seating section while we continued to wait for the hostess to return. By 12:30 p.m. we were tired of waiting and got up to leave. That was when the hostess returned. She had the audacity to tell us that she was there all along and argue with us (the customer)! As we walked out, she rudely spoke up "your choice". Seriously?! I used to LOVE this Chili's but it has gone down the drain. I will never come back here again! Sadly the kids love this place! Guess we will have to find another one to go to.

This chilis has terrible service.  They don't answer the phone for call ahead seating and every time I come they take people out of order for the a seating list.  The hostess is rude and obviously management doesn't care enough to help them.  Bar service is slow,  food service is slow. ...better to drive to pines.

Worst chilis ever...and ive been to a ton. Food always tastes...just old here. I dont know why. Best thing about it-u can play games at your table...worst thing-all the ordering and bill payment is expected to be done on these machines and every time we have gone and they have been broken! This is such an ordeal and we have asked to just avoid the machines altogether but the servers arent too bright. They seem to have forgotten how to do this basic job so they have to go get 5 of their friends to try and figure that out for 10+ minutes each time. When you want to go out to relax, this isnt ideal. I have received numerous giftcards and give them all away because I just dislike Chilis so much now because of this location! It just makes me sad

I've been going to this Chilis since they opened, and I will never go back. I was there last night for dinner (my birthday) and ordered a steak medium well. Everyone's food came out and my steak was bloody raw and COLD on the inside. I sent it back and 40 mins later still no steak. At this point everyone was finished eating and I didn't want to eat alone so I flagged down a host and asked him to please cancel my order and get me a manager.  5 mins later a woman came out and shoved a sizzling plate in my face saying "here's your steak". I told here I didn't want it. She shoved it in front of me again and the hot plate almost burned my arm. I asked to speak with a manager and she said she was the manager. She rolled her eyes at me and asked me to take the steak. I refused so she walked away, came back, and shoved the check in my face. I asked her why she was doing that to me and she rolled her eyes again and walked away. I got up and asked the host help. We finally got our bill and left. My son was crying because of the way the manager treated us. Plus, it was absolutely filthy in there.
Not great service, food took a long time. Drinks were way too strong. I tried to do the survey at the table and I couldn't. Receipt also didn't print out!

I saw that most of the guest around me were treated nicely. I repeatedly thanked my waitress for refilling my beverages for me and the children at my table and she refused to acknowledge me or engage with our table. That is what sets a great waiter aside from others, not just refilling our beverages and serving us beverages. It'st looking happy and being helpful. I don't like rating anywhere bad based on one person. But when you see other tables being served by other wait staff with above and beyond service it makes you wonder, why is she not happy to serve us. Should she be in this place? This is the only reason I wouldn't give this place 4 stars out of 5. It only deserves a 3 based on food the table service made me rate it lower. My girls don't rate based on service they only know about food quality and they did the survey post dining on the table tablet. They gave neutral remarks despite the tablet we played games on. I am also rated based on service in my job that is why I find it important to treat everyone like they are family.
Meh...It's Chili's.  If you've been to one you've been to them all.  Nothing really stood out except the amount of weight I gained!  Quick food for me and the family!

Very disappointed with their Togo service..order beef fajitas...it was cold. Order burger bits with no cheese received it with cheese..order a burger medium well ..got it well well done. I suppose if you order food to go...they put no effort.
Wes and Johnny (in the bar) are the best! Very attentive. They always provide the best service!

We ate here because we had a gift certificate because of a bad experience we had at their Red Road location. That being said, we won't be going back to Chilis again.  We went for lunch and arrived at 11:45 to beat the lunch rush.  But that didn't matter. There was only one pregnant waitress working. And while she did her best to keep up, she just couldn't.  We ordered and it took over 30 minutes to get our food. When it arrived our burgers were over done and cold. I asked for extra pickles and was told it would be 50 cents extra because they make them fresh on the premises. These pickles were horrible!  They basically tasted liked cucumbers dipped in dill, but not pickled. The only good part of the meal were the French fries, which tasted great. Because we had a gift certificate we had to have the waitress take it to apply to the bill before we could pay the balance. Because there was only one waitress we had a very long wait for her to do the adjustment for us to pay.  As a chain, I cannot recommend this place.

I hate to give a company a negative review, but this is so far the worst chillies I have ever been to. The bathrooms where dirty. The waiter was slow as hell. By the time they served us the food was even cold. I spoke to the manager and told him about it and it was irrelevant. I told the waiter take the food back and thank God LA granja was open and we had dinner there. Do yourself a favor if you plan going to this location go to McDonald's for faster service and better quality!

location: Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT
review: Great place for lunch.  They have a 2 for 1 tap beer special that is just perfect for that mid-afternoon lunch break. We sat at the bar which in my experience always helps get attended quicker and our order out faster.  I ordered a Prime Rib mex bowl, that was amazing. So flavorful and with a good deal of spice. They top it with a honey and jalapeño alioli that I wish I could buy a bottle to put it on everything I eat from now on. Seriously, it was that good. It also comes with sliced avocados and corn bean salsa that just made the whole thing taste extra fresh.  My friend had the seared shrimp mex bowl. She said she enjoyed it, especially the crunch from the tortilla strips. I tried her shrimp and it was really nicely cooked, not chewy like at some other places that leave shrimp on the grill too long.  Really good. Can't wait to go habe lunch here again.

We went for a quick dinner tonight and had the most horrible experience. The waitress was the worse. We ordered drinks and they were so bad and told her and she said well that's what you get for two for one. We were willing to pay for other drinks but with an attitude like that, no thank you. We had to ask for our chips and dip after waiting for about 15 minutes. We had no utensils, small plates or napkins. We complained to the manager and he was as useless as our rude and horrible waitress.  When our food came it was cold, shrimp wasn't cooked and broccoli was over cooked. I didn't even eat it but didn't even send it back or complain. Was just ready to be out of there. Stay away!! Not worth it.

Night out for Dinner. We arrived and it looked like it was not full. Plenty of tables empty and we still have to wait 5-10 minutes to sit. However, once we sat down, our waitress was excellent. Her service was great, food was great, and personality was good as well. The wait time is the only thing that held me from leaving them a 5 star review.

So the food runner came to our table and one of my friends asked for limes, he said "sir could we please have some limes?" and the food runner  said "my name is not sir, its ****" cant remember his name but super rude. givong 2 stars because ive had some decent experiences. food runner was tall, hispanic and had a chinstrap. I think his name was joey?

I was here back in June of this year and was utterly shocked. The restaurant was dirty, the service was slow and the food was mediocre. I received a gift card for Chili's and I'm like okay, might as well give it another shot. I ordered two half rack of ribs with fries. Got home, opened my box, and there was a HAIR casually sitting in my box of food. I am completely DONE with this location and Chili's period. I don't even care if I get another gift card to this place. It's disgusting. Don't waste your money.
Eaten here several times. Never had a bad experience. Burgers are delish. Try their molten salted caramel dessert. Wow! Salt and sweet explosion...worth the calories.

Food was bad orders were wrong waiters and Manager treated us (teenagers) like we were stupid. gave us like 4 fries with out burger, had to send the burger back twice and it was still wrong. Terrible service

Horrible and lousy food. How do you mess up a traditional grilled chicken on rice. Well they did! It came out cold and very rubbery looking. I asked to please have it heated . The waiter in the bar area asked if I wanted a completely new one and I said no just put the chicken breast on the grill. He came back with my dish within 1 minute and now it was scalding steaming hot. Red flag!!! Microwave but I tried it and it was just horrible worse than cold after it got nuked. I asked for the check I had two margaritas on the check. Paid for it and they tried to charge me the tip on the entire check even on the dish that i returned. Last time I frequent any chilis. The manager didn't even show up to say sorry or ask if we maybe wanted something else. Terrible and sad because this is a good location.

Good food,terrible service. Server A took our order and said server B would be right there to take our order. Didn't happen. ServerA finally took it. After 15 minutes I had the nerve to ask where our food was. Miracle, it appeared by server C. Finally after I realized there was no cell service or wi-fi. I asked for our check from B. D showed up and said he was sorry I was in a bad mood. All I wanted was a check and a quick exit. NEVER again at any chilis.

Worst location ever!!! First tried to call a Togo order in and got a busy signal for 20 mins. Finally decided to drive there. As we walked in a little was on her phone timing to see how long for lettuce and guacamole for her Togo order. She explained she waited 45 for her food. Then her timer for the guacamole and lettuce was on 14 mins. The Togo person stated they were making the guacamole. Finally she just walked out and left her food there. Finally we were able to order our food. After taking with the Togo person about there phone being busy they said yes we are busy here so we took the phone on the hook. Wow. Anyways ordered my food Queso and a chicken ranch quesadillas. Took about 40 mins for the food. They had brought it out and it was sitting there for about 12 mins as I was timing to see how long it would take if it was our food. Finally said something to someone after they asked if I needed anything else. I said yes I believe that is my food that has been sitting there for 12 mins because I've been timing it. Got the food home and the quesadilla is disgusting. The bacon is not only Burnt and taste like it, but it extremely hard and not even stuck together like it should be. The Queso is ice cold. Chips are super oily, and there is a few chips in our salsa. First thing we thought is could this be someone else salsa they reused? None the less I am one unhappy pregnant women. I couldn't call to complain because the line is still busy and didn't think to take the drive back for the whole thing to be messed up again. Will be calling the store tomorrow and corporate. I am a server myself and know it gets busy, but this is ridiculous.

I am giving them 2 stars and not 1 because I used to come here all the time. I love chilis. I love to get their honey Chipotle crispers, Texas cheese fries, and mango iced tea. But I went there an hour before closing and as soon I walked in the floors were dirty, the tables were dirty. Mind you it's 10pm and they close at 11pm. I'd expect them to clean in between customers, but they wait until the end of the day to clean up all the floors. It was disgusting. When I had the chips and salsa served to me I found used chips in my salsa. The silverware still had food on it. They don't wash your dishes or silverware that well. I dont mind the water stain left on it, but there was a piece of meat with cheese on my knife still. I addressed the waiter and he didn't over anything. The manager walked by and saw my disgusted face and me just sitting there not touching my food for him to say something. He told me that it is not possible that we reuse the salsa and that the chip machine is next the the salsa. I just said okay and asked for the check, so I can get out of there. He was sweet enough to not charge me for the food or my drinks even though I already drank my drink. I wouldn't be surprised if they didn't pass the health inspection. It seems like the workers don't care about chilis and just does whatever, they are very lazy also. I understand its hard work because I too work in the serving industry, but no one likes to eat in a filthy place.

Last night my family and I went to dinner. There wasn't a lot of people so we expected our food to come out right away. We sat down for more than 15 minutes and still had to wait for our drinks. Our drinks finally came out when our appetizers came out. The food was good except they messed up a few of our orders. The service wasn't the best we have had at Chilis. We had to ask for our refills several times and we never ended up getting the refills. Little disappointed with the service but, the food was good.

This has been a horrible dinner experience. The ribs and the burgers were dry. The chicken crispers tasted bad and the pork fajitas worse. Asides from that the service was incredibly slow. Not coming back here ever.

WASTE OF TIME! -Every time I eat here and at the Pines location it's the same thing. There were only eight tables occupied in the dining side. Slow day for Chilli's, therefore no excuse.  We had been waiting for ten minutes no one had come to our table, not even water was offered. We overheard the table next to us say they had been waiting a long time and hadn't even met their server. We left without ordering.  We also do take out from time to time and the orders are always wrong. Chilli's corporate team needs to rethink their management choices.

I have worked in restaurants throughout my life I have even worked for Chilis in Aventura and in NY.. this particular Chili's has horrible service and inconsistent food. this evening I practically put in my own order got my own napkins and silverware then had to bus my own table. I think they were so bothered by it that something was put in my salad! My mouth was on fire and I was literally sick to my stomach from eating there this evening! Spoke to manager and he denied anything being different about a salad that I have been ordering there for over 8 years. He offered to remake salad, as if I would eat anything else from there and then he looked at me as if he was doing me me a huge favor by not charging me for food that made me sick! Meanwhile my entire family dinner was turned into a stressful evening.

I have been sitting here at this chilis with friends waiting for a chicken sandwich for over an hour.  It's not a busy Night at all, looking around multiple table sit uncleared or bused.  Very poor service for a slow Thursday night.  I asked for water with my drink.  I didn't get one.  Asked for it again with my food order.  Still didn't get one.  Someone else at the table asked for water and he eventually brought everyone a water.  Too bad cause I was hungry but if I place an order at 9:30 and at 10:50 I still don't have it there is something wrong.  I paid for the drink and left without eating.  I won't be returning.

We live in miami lakes and travel all the way to this location because they have the best waiter there! Antonio is awesome! Excellent customer service! We are always in and out. The most we wait is to be seated but as for antonio's services. Extraordinary! We sat once at the bar and had a terrible experience with one of the bartenders. We order our specific drinks, which Antonio doesn't even ask anymore. He knows what we like. But the gentlemen that day at the bar told us we had to choose another drink because he wasn't preparing that in his bar. I was soooo livid. I just wanted to walk out of there but... Antonio's helpfulness and great customer service is what has us as faithful Chilis customers! Thanks Antonio!

It was NOT what we expected of a Chili's restaurant.  The food was pretty cold when it made it to our table.  The steak was HARD.  It's almost as though the waitress knew how bad the food was that she avoided our table.  We kept having to flag her down as though we were waving in an airplane.  Not sure what happened to this Chili's.  Interestingly enough, my brother came a couple of weeks before and had the same experience.
Friendly staff! Service was fast and efficient! Food came out hot and tasty. Drinks were good. Our server was super pleasant and caring. I highly recommend this Chili's location in Pembroke Pines.

Chilis is one of our favorite places for lunch be it a family lunch with kids or grab a quick bite at lunch break. We  really enjoy the bottomless soup & salad deal. I had the chicken enchilada soup & my hubby had the chili bowl. Both were delicious and oh so cheesy! Our server JP's service was outstanding. Thank you JP for the extra soup to go. We will be back soon.

Never coming here again! The food had horrible presentation, and parts of it were cold, and the sides were stale and hard! The fries tasted as if they were literally microwaved before being put on the plate. The broccoli was hard and not even steamed properly. My friend ordered a burger and all the ingredients looked old as if they were left out for too long. It was not even worth paying $40 for the both of us! We called the manager for assistance (we don't know his name, he never introduced himself) but he was so rude and annoyed! He on quote said " I can promise you that it WASN'T microwaved" and opened his eyes at us with a slick smirk. NEVER coming to this location again.

Come to this chili's often and for whatever reason, tonight it was terrible.  Food order was messed up, wait time before they realized we were seated was excessive, and getting any service from the staff required actually getting up and asking since they just flew by the table. Cheese burger with no cheese. Salad without the dressing. Asked for some fixings to be removed from a fajita & they left them all there.  As mentioned, usually this Chili's is good but tonight, terrible.  Probably come back since it's close but, maybe not, it was that bad tonight!!!

I've eaten at this location before without issue--however, ordered for curbside take-out today, and had a bad experience. Food was not ready at pick-up time, was put on hold for over five minutes waiting to let the store know we had arrived, went in for our food, and received a steak too undercooked to eat. Very disappointed in this experience.

Went in for a quick, weekday lunch with my guest and left very disappointed. Apparently, the free chips & salsa in the lounge/bar are no longer free as per their GM Amanda. The chips we ordered were burnt and the Triple Dipper appeared as it had been fried in old oil. I've been coming to this Chilis for many years and sadly I will not be returning.
Food is never cooked properly.  They don't seem to know how to prepare an order correctly. Service is horrible and the place looks run down. Very dirty
